content: nor thwind headband if you ve ever wanted to learn how to knit brioche we designed this headband pattern for you squishy brioche stitches make for a cosy accessory that s as functional as it is stylish keep your ears toasty warm this season the northwind headband is worked in brioche stitch worked flat the headband begins and ends with a stockinette tube to complete the project you ll twist this tube and graft the ends together the brioche stitch fans out on either side almost like a bow it s a quick and soothingly repetitive project that calls for only one skein this means exploring new to you stitches with one simple purchase or even a quick dive into your stash to see what s there this is fast small budget knitting at it s best © ysolda ltd 2021 in purchasing this pattern you agree to print and use this pattern only for your personal non-commercial use you may not distribute or sell electronic or paper copies of this pattern please contact support@ysolda com if you have any questions about the pattern abbreviations set up row 1 use larger needle to work beg begin ning across sts as follows *p1 from back needle k1 from front needle repeat from dpn s double pointed needle s * until all sts have been worked pin a eor end of round marker or safety pin to the front of the work to mark the rs k knit continue to work back and forth in row p purl using the larger needle pm place marker set up row 2 sl1 wyif k1 *sl1yo k1 repeat repeat repeat ing from * to end round s round s next row sl1 wyif *brk sl1yo repeat from * to last st k1 rs right side repeat last row for every row to create sl slip x st s -
